meta.dc:subject: legislation
meta.dc:rights: the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region

section.name: s1
section.heading: Citation
section.content: These regulations may be cited as the Pharmacy and Poisons Regulations.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In these regulations, unless the context otherwise requires—
subsection.def: antimonial poisons (含銻毒藥) means organic and inorganic compounds of antimony;
arsenical poisons (含砷毒藥) means organic and inorganic compounds of arsenic;
authorized person (獲授權人) means a person whose name is entered in the register of authorized persons; (2 of 2015 s. 32)
British Pharmaceutical Codex (英國藥學藥典), British Pharmacopoeia (英國藥典), British National Formulary (英國國家處方集) and British Veterinary Codex (英國獸醫藥方集) include the supplements thereto;
expiry date (使用期限)—see paragraph (1A); (19 of 2020 s. 5)
food (食物) includes a beverage;
GMP Guide (《指引》) means the Good Manufacturing Practice Guide issued under regulation 28A as revised from time to time under that regulation; (2 of 2015 s. 32)

medicine for the internal treatment of human and animal ailments (用於治療人類及動物病患的內服藥物) includes any medicine to be administered by injection, but does not include any mouth-wash, eye-drops, eye-lotion, ear-drops, nasal drops, douche or similar article;
register of authorized persons (獲授權人名冊) means the register of authorized persons kept under regulation 30B; (2 of 2015 s. 32)
Tribunal (審裁處) means the Pharmacy and Poisons Appeal Tribunal established by section 30 of the Ordinance; (L.N. 369 of 1980)
veterinary institution (獸醫機構) means a veterinary hospital, veterinary clinic or other premises where sick animals are treated.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of these regulations, the expiry date of a pharmaceutical product is the date determined by the manufacturer of the product—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the basis of the product’s specifications; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on the assumption that the product is stored under conditions suitable to it,

subsection.continued: as the date after which the product should not be used. (19 of 2020 s. 5)

subsection.content: In these regulations any reference to an alkaloid shall include a reference to any salt of that alkaloid, and, in a case where the esters of an alkaloid are included in the Poisons List by virtue of the words “its esters”, to any esters of that alkaloid.

subsection.leadIn: Any reference in the Schedules to these regulations to the percentage of a poison contained in any substance or preparation shall, unless otherwise expressly provided, be construed in the following manner, that is to say, a reference to a substance or preparation containing 1 per cent of any poison means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a solid, that 1 gram of the poison is contained in every 100 grams of the substance or preparation; (E.R. 5 of 2020)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a liquid, that 1 millilitre of the poison, or, if the poison itself is a solid, 1 gram of the poison, is contained in every 100 millilitres of the substance or preparation, (E.R. 5 of 2020)

subsection.continued: and so in proportion for any greater or less percentage.

subsection.content: Substances listed in Divisions A in the Schedules to these regulations are those whose uses are essentially medicinal, whilst substances listed in Divisions B are not normally used medicinally. (L.N. 41 of 2007)
Where in these regulations reference is made to a numbered section the reference shall be a reference to that section of the Ordinance.

subsection.def: Where functions are conferred on a committee by any provision of these regulations, references in such provision to “the Committee” shall be construed as references to the executive committee established under section 4A of the Ordinance for the purpose of performing such functions. (L.N. 369 of 1980)

section.name: s2A
section.heading: Poisons List
section.content: The Poisons List is set out in Schedule 10.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Application of section 22 restricted to Schedule 1
section.content: Section 22 shall only apply to those poisons included in Part 1 of the Poisons List which are also included in Schedule 1 but not included in Schedule 3.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Extension of labelling provisions and relaxation with respect to poisons in Schedule 6

subsection.content: Subject to paragraph (2), the provisions of section 27 and regulations 12 to 17 (which provisions relate to the labelling of poisons) shall apply to sales exempted by section 32, and shall also apply to the supply of poisons (otherwise than on sale) and references in those provisions to the sale and the seller of poisons shall be deemed to refer to the supply and the supplier of poisons respectively.

subsection.leadIn: In the case of the sale or supply of any of the poisons included in Schedule 6 to a person who— (E.R. 5 of 2020)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: carries on a business in the course of which poisons are regularly sold by way of wholesale dealing or are regularly used in the manufacture of other articles; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: requires the poison for the purpose of that business,

subsection.continued: if the outside of the package in which the poison is sold or supplied is labelled conspicuously with words indicating the dangerous properties of the poison, it shall be necessary to comply only with regulation 15 and section 27(a) and section 27(d) (as modified by regulation 17).

section.name: s5
section.heading: Extension of section 22 to sales wholesale etc. and relaxation of the section

content.leadIn: Section 22 shall apply to sales exempted by section 32, except sales of poisons to be exported to purchasers outside Hong Kong, and shall also apply to the supply in the form of a commercial sample, otherwise than on sale, of any substance included in Schedule 1 in like manner as if references in section 22 to the sale and seller of poisons respectively included references to the supply and the supplier of poisons in the form of commercial samples: (E.R. 5 of 2020)

proviso.name: proviso
proviso.leadIn: Provided that section 22 shall not apply to the sale or supply of any article by the licensed manufacturer thereof or by a person carrying on a business in the course of which poisons are regularly sold by way of wholesale dealing, if— (2 of 2015 s. 35)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the article is sold or supplied to a person carrying on a business in the course of which poisons are regularly sold or are regularly used in the manufacture of other articles; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the seller or supplier is reasonably satisfied that the purchaser requires the article for the purpose of that business.

subsection.content: Section 22(1) shall, in its application to sales exempted by section 32 and to the supply in the form of commercial samples of substances included in Schedule 1, be deemed to be satisfied if the person to whom the poison or sample is sold or supplied is known by the person in charge of the department of the business through which the sale or supply is effected to be a person to whom the poison or sample may properly be sold or supplied. (E.R. 5 of 2020)

subsection.leadIn: Subject to paragraph (4), so much of section 22(3)(b) as requires an entry in the poisons book to be signed by the purchaser of a poison shall not, as respects the sale of a poison to a person for the purpose of his trade, business or profession, apply if the following requirements are satisfied—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the seller shall obtain before the completion of the sale an order in writing signed by the purchaser stating his name and address, trade, business or profession, the name and quantity of the article to be purchased, and the purpose for which it is required;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the seller shall be reasonably satisfied that the signature is that of the person purporting to have signed the order, and that that person carries on the trade, business or profession stated in the order, being one in which the poison to be purchased is used; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the article sold is sent by post, it shall be sent by registered post.

subsection.content: Where a person represents that he urgently requires a poison for the purpose of his trade, business or profession, the seller may, if he is reasonably satisfied that the person so requires the poison and is, by reason of some emergency, unable before delivery either to furnish to the seller an order in writing duly signed or to attend and sign the entry in the book, deliver the poison to the purchaser on an undertaking by the purchaser to furnish such an order within 48 hours next following.

Any purchaser by whom an undertaking under paragraph (4) has been given who fails to deliver to the seller a signed order in accordance with the undertaking, or any person who for the purpose of obtaining delivery of any poison makes a statement which is to his knowledge false in any material particular shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 12 months. (2 of 2015 s. 35)

In the case of a sale or the supplying of a poison included in Schedule 1 to an institution such of the provisions of this regulation as require the purchaser to state his trade, business or profession and the seller to be satisfied with respect thereto shall not apply and for the reference in paragraph (4) to the purposes of the purchaser’s trade, business or profession there shall be substituted in the case of any such sale a reference to the name of the institution and the full name and rank or position held at the institution of the person making the order. (E.R. 5 of 2020)

section.name: s6
section.heading: Relaxation of section 28(3) in the case of certain medicines
section.leadIn: The requirements of section 28(3) (which requires particulars of medicines supplied or dispensed under that section to be entered in a book) shall be satisfied in respect of medicines included in Schedule 1, but need not be satisfied in respect of other medicines which are supplied by— (E.R. 5 of 2020)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a registered medical practitioner for the purposes of medical treatment; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an authorized seller of poisons on and in accordance with a prescription given by a registered medical practitioner.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Exemption from the provisions relating solely to Schedule 1
section.leadIn: The provisions of these regulations and of the Ordinance (as modified by these regulations) which apply solely to the substances in Schedule 1 shall not apply to— (E.R. 5 of 2020)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: machine-spread plasters;

paragraph.name: b
d
paragraph.content: corn paints in which the only poison is a poison included in the Poisons List under the item “Cannabis”.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Complete exemption for articles and substances in Schedule 2

subsection.leadIn: Subject to paragraph (2), nothing in the Ordinance or these regulations shall apply—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to any article in Group I of Schedule 2; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to any of the articles or substances specified in the second column of Group II of Schedule 2 opposite the description of the poison specified in the first column thereof. (L.N. 85 of 1987; E.R. 5 of 2020)

subsection.content: Notwithstanding paragraph (1)(b), Parts 6, 7, 8, 9 and 10 of these regulations shall apply to every article or substance referred to in that paragraph, that is a pharmaceutical product within the meaning of the Ordinance. (L.N. 85 of 1987; 2 of 2015 s. 36)

part.name: P2
part.heading: Additional Restrictions on the Sale of Poisons

section.name: s9
section.heading: Additional restriction of sale of poisons in Schedule 3

subsection.content: No person shall sell any poison included in Schedule 3, except on and in accordance with a prescription given by a registered medical practitioner, registered dentist or registered veterinary surgeon. (L.N. 614 of 1997; E.R. 5 of 2020)
This regulation shall apply to the sale of any such poison, including a medicine exempted by section 28, but shall not apply to any sale exempted by section 32.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this regulation a prescription shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in writing and be signed by the person giving it with his usual signature and be dated by him;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify the address of the person giving it;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: specify the name and address of the person for whose treatment it is given or, if the prescription is given by a registered veterinary surgeon, of the person to whom the medicine is to be delivered; (L.N. 614 of 1997)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: have written thereon, if given by a dentist, the words “For dental treatment only 祇限牙科醫療用”, or, if given by a registered veterinary surgeon, the words “For animal treatment only 祇限醫治禽畜用”; and (L.N. 614 of 1997)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: indicate the total amount of the medicine to be supplied and the dose to be taken or administered.

subsection.leadIn: The person dispensing the prescription shall comply with the following requirements—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the prescription shall not be dispensed more than once unless the prescriber has directed either—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that it may be dispensed a stated number of times; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: that it may be dispensed at stated intervals;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: at the time of dispensing there shall be noted on the prescription above the signature of the prescriber the name and address of the seller and the date on which the prescription is dispensed; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: except in the case of a prescription which may be dispensed again, the prescription shall, for a period of 2 years, be retained and kept on the premises on which it was dispensed in such manner as to be readily available for inspection.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Restriction of sales by listed sellers of poisons
section.content: No listed seller of poisons shall sell any poison other than a solution of ammonia, hydrochloric acid, nitric acid, potassium quadroxalate or sulphuric acid, except in a closed container as closed by the manufacturer or other person from whom the poison was obtained.

section.name: s10A
section.heading: Prohibition on dispensing of prescriptions by listed sellers of poisons
section.content: No listed seller of poisons shall dispense any prescription for medicine.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Restriction of sale of strychnine

subsection.content: No person shall sell or supply strychnine except as an ingredient in a medicine.

subsection.leadIn: This regulation shall extend to transactions exempted by section 32, but shall not apply to the sale of strychnine—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by way of wholesale dealing;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to be exported to purchasers outside Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for the purpose of being compounded in medicines prescribed or administered by a registered medical practitioner or registered veterinary surgeon; or (L.N. 614 of 1997)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: to a person or institution concerned with education, scientific research or chemical analysis, for the purpose of that education, research or analysis.

part.name: P3
part.heading: Supplementary Provisions with respect to Labelling and Containers of Poisons

section.name: s12
section.heading: Manner of labelling containers

subsection.content: Subject to paragraphs (2) and (3), the particulars with which the container of a poison is required to be labelled under section 27 and under these regulations, shall appear in a conspicuous position on the container in which the poison is sold and on every box or other covering of whatever nature enclosing the container, and the particulars shall be clearly and distinctly set out and not in any way obscured or obliterated.

Where the poison is contained in a cachet or similar article it shall not be necessary to label the article itself, if every box or other covering in which the article is enclosed is labelled in accordance with paragraph (1).

Nothing in section 27 or in this regulation or regulations 13 to 17 shall be deemed to require the labelling of any transparent cover or any wrapper, hamper, packing case, crate or other covering used solely for the purposes of transport or delivery.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Labelling of name of poison

content.leadIn: For the purposes of section 27(a) and regulation 22(3)(a), the name of a poison shall be the term under which it is included in the Poisons List:

proviso.name: proviso
proviso.leadIn: Provided that, where the term describes a group of poisons and not the poison specifically, the name of the poison shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the poison is the subject of a monograph in either the British Pharmacopoeia, the British Pharmaceutical Codex or the British Veterinary Codex, one of the names or synonyms or abbreviated names set out at the head of the monograph; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case, the accepted scientific name or the name descriptive of the true nature and origin of the poison.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of the proviso to paragraph (1), where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a substance is the subject of a monograph in the British Pharmacopoeia, the British Pharmaceutical Codex or the British Veterinary Codex, or any dilution, concentration or admixture of such substance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a preparation is contained in the British Pharmacopoeia, the British Pharmaceutical Codex, the British National Formulary or the British Veterinary Codex, or any dilution, concentration or admixture of such preparation; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a surgical dressing of a type for which a standard is prescribed in the British Pharmaceutical Codex,

subsection.continued: it shall be sufficient to state the name, synonym or abbreviated name used to describe the substance, preparation or surgical dressing with the addition of the letters B.P., B.P.C., B.N.F. or B. Vet. C., as the case may be.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Labelling of particulars as to proportions of the poison
section.leadIn: For the purpose of section 27(b) (which requires preparation containing poisons to be labelled with particulars as to the proportion of each poison therein)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a preparation containing a poison specified in the first column of Schedule 4, it shall be sufficient to state on the label the particulars specified in the second column of that Schedule against the description of the poison; (E.R. 5 of 2020)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a substance, preparation or surgical dressing which is named in accordance with regulation 13(2), it shall not be necessary to state on the label the proportion of the poison contained in the substance, preparation or surgical dressing, and in the case of any dilution, concentration or admixture of such substance or preparation it shall be sufficient to state the proportion which the substance or preparation bears to the total ingredients of that dilution, concentration or admixture;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: where the poison is in tablets, pills, cachets, capsules, lozenges or similar articles, it shall be sufficient to state on the label of the box or other covering in which the articles are enclosed the number of the articles and the amount of the poison, or in the case of a preparation or substance mentioned in subparagraph (b), the amount of the preparation or substance, contained in each article; (E.R. 5 of 2020)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: where the poison is in ampoules it shall be sufficient to show the name of the poison contained in it together with, either its concentration (if in solution or in emulsified form), or the quantity (if in solid form); and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: where any proportion is stated as a percentage, the statement shall indicate whether the percentage is calculated on the basis of weight in weight, weight in volume, or volume in volume.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Poisons to be labelled “Poison 毒藥” or other bilingual text specified in Schedule 5 etc.

subsection.content: For the purposes of section 27(c), a container of a medicine must be labelled in clear print with the text in both English and Chinese as specified in Schedule 5 in respect of the medicine or the class to which the medicine belongs.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of section 27(ca), a container of a substance or mixture of substances that is not a medicine must be labelled with the following text in clear print—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the text in both English and Chinese as specified in Schedule 5 in respect of the substance or mixture or the class to which the substance or mixture belongs; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if no text is so specified, “Poison 毒藥”.

subsection.content: The text referred to in paragraph (1) or (2) must not be modified in meaning by the addition of any other texts or marks.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Special precautions in the case of certain articles

subsection.leadIn: No person shall sell or supply any poison—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a liquid other than a medicine, in a container of a capacity of not more than 2 litres, unless the container is labelled with the words “Not to be taken 忌食”; and (L.N. 22 of 1982)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of an embrocation, liniment, lotion, liquid antiseptic, or other liquid medicine for external application, unless the container is labelled with the type of preparation and the words “For external use only 祇供外用”. (L.N. 137 of 1978)

subsection.content: No person shall sell or supply any compressed hydrocyanic acid, unless the container thereof is labelled with the words “Warning. This container holds poisonous gas and should only be opened and used by persons having expert knowledge of the precautions to be taken in its use. 警告：此容器內載毒氣，祇限由具有專門知識而在使用上知所提防之人士開啟及使用。”. (E.R. 5 of 2020)

This regulation shall be in addition to the other requirements of the Ordinance and of these regulations with respect to labelling and shall apply to the transactions referred to in sections 28 and 32, but shall not apply to the sale or supply of poisons to be exported to purchasers outside Hong Kong.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Name of seller and address of premises

subsection.leadIn: Section 27(d) (which requires the container of a poison to be labelled with the name of the seller and the address of the premises on which it was sold) shall apply to the transactions referred to in section 32, but shall not apply—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of an article sold for the purpose of being sold again in the same container; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to poisons to be exported to purchasers outside Hong Kong.

subsection.content: The requirements of section 27(d) shall be deemed to be satisfied, in the case of a poison supplied from a warehouse or depot, if the container of the poison is labelled with the address of the supplier’s principal place of business.

Where any poison (other than a substance included in Schedule 1) is sold in a container and outer covering, being the container and covering in which it was obtained by the seller, it shall be sufficient if the name of the seller and the address of the premises on which it was sold appear only on the outer covering. (E.R. 5 of 2020)

Where the names of more than one person or more than one address appear on any label, there shall also be words on the label indicating clearly which person is the seller and at which of the addresses the poison was sold.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Form of containers of poisons

subsection.leadIn: No person shall sell, whether wholesale or retail, or supply any poison unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is contained in a container impervious to the poison and sufficiently stout to prevent leakage arising from the ordinary risks of handling and transport; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a liquid contained in a glass bottle or plastic container containing not more than 2 litres, not being a medicine made up ready to be taken for the internal treatment of human or animal ailments, the outer surface of the bottle or container is fluted vertically with ribs or grooves recognizable by touch. (L.N. 22 of 1982)

subsection.content: Paragraph (1)(a) shall apply to the transactions referred to in section 28, and paragraph (1)(b) shall apply to the transactions exempted by section 32 but shall not apply to the sale or supply of poisons to be exported to purchasers outside Hong Kong.

section.name: s19
section.heading: Storage of poisons

subsection.content: No person shall store any poison except in a container impervious to the poison and sufficiently stout to prevent leakage from the container arising from the ordinary risks of handling.

subsection.leadIn: No person shall store any poison included in Part 1 of the Poisons List in any retail shop or premises used in connexion therewith unless the substance is stored— (2 of 2015 s. 38)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in a receptacle reserved solely for the storage of poisons, which receptacle shall be locked with an adequate lock the key for which shall be retained by the registered pharmacist; and (L.N. 197 of 1989; L.N. 366 of 1995)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in a part of the premises to which customers are not permitted to have access and which is partitioned off or otherwise separated from the remainder of the premises.

subsection.content: No food shall be stored in the part of the premises where such poison is stored. (2 of 2015 s. 38)

section.name: s20
section.heading: Transport of poisons
section.content: No person shall consign any poison for transport unless it is sufficiently stoutly packed to avoid leakage arising from the ordinary risks of handling and transport.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Special provisions with respect to the transport of poisons in Schedule 7

subsection.content: No person shall consign for transport by carrier any poison included in Schedule 7 unless the outside of the package containing the article is labelled conspicuously with the name or description of the poison as set forth in that Schedule and a notice indicating that it is to be kept separate from food and from empty containers in which food has been contained.

No person shall knowingly transport any poison included in Schedule 7, either on his own behalf or for another person, in any vehicle in which food is being transported, unless the food is carried in a part of the vehicle effectively separated from that containing the poison, or is otherwise adequately protected from the risk of contamination.
This regulation shall not apply to medicines.

part.name: P5
part.heading: Special Provisions with respect to Institutions

section.name: s22
section.heading: Supply of medicines to out-patients from certain institutions, etc.

subsection.leadIn: Nothing in the Ordinance or in these regulations, except regulation 16, this Part and Part 7, applies with respect to— (L.N. 262 of 1995; 19 of 2020 s. 6)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any medicine dispensed in an institution where the dispensing is under the supervision of a registered pharmacist or other person as may be approved by the Director of Health; or (L.N. 76 of 1989)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any medicine for the treatment of animals supplied from a veterinary institution which is under the superintendence of a registered veterinary surgeon, (L.N. 614 of 1997)

subsection.continued: if the requirements of this regulation are satisfied in relation thereto.

subsection.content: The medicine shall not be supplied except by, or on and in accordance with a prescription of, a duly registered medical practitioner for the purposes of medical treatment, or a registered dentist for the purposes of dental treatment, or a registered veterinary surgeon for the purposes of animal treatment. (L.N. 614 of 1997)

subsection.leadIn: In a case where a substance included in Schedule 1 is supplied, a record shall be kept on the premises in such a way that there can readily be traced at any time during a period of 2 years after the date on which the substance was supplied the following particulars— (E.R. 5 of 2020)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name and quantity of the poison supplied;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date on which the poison was supplied;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the name and address of the person to whom the poison was supplied; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the name of the person who supplied the poison or who gave the prescription upon which it was supplied.

subsection.leadIn: The container of the medicine shall be labelled—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: with a designation sufficient to identify the institution or veterinary institution from which it was supplied; and (L.N. 137 of 1978; 2 of 2015 s. 39)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of a poison supplied from a veterinary institution, with the words “For animal treatment only 祇限醫治禽畜用”.

subsection.content: The medicine shall be clearly labelled with instructions for use in either English or Chinese. (2 of 2015 s. 39)
In the case of a medicine to which regulation 16 applies the requirements of that regulation shall be satisfied in addition to the requirements of this regulation.

section.name: s23
section.heading: Supply of medicines for use in institutions, etc.

subsection.content: In any institution in which medicines are dispensed in a dispensing or pharmaceutical department in charge of a registered pharmacist or any other person approved by the Director of Health for that purpose, no medicine containing a poison shall be supplied from that department, except in cases of emergency, for use in the wards, operating theatres or other sections of the institution, except in accordance with paragraphs (2) and (3). (L.N. 76 of 1989)

Subject to paragraph (4), the medicines shall not be supplied except upon a written order signed by a duly registered medical practitioner, registered dentist, or by a person authorized to be in charge of a ward, theatre or other section of the institution.
The container of the medicine shall be labelled with words describing its contents. (2 of 2015 s. 40)

In the case of an emergency, a medicine containing a poison may be supplied without a written order if the person ordering the medicine undertakes to furnish a written order in respect of that medicine within the next 24 hours.

section.name: s24
section.heading: Storage of poisons in institutions

subsection.content: In any institution in which medicines are dispensed in a dispensing or pharmaceutical department in the charge of a person appointed for the purpose, all poisons other than those issued for use within the institution shall be stored in that department.

subsection.leadIn: In any institution to which paragraph (1) does not apply all poisons other than those issued for use within the institution shall be stored—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the charge of a person appointed for the purpose by the governing body or person in control of the institution; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of substances included in Schedule 1 either in a cupboard or drawer, or on a shelf, reserved for the storage of poisons. (2 of 2015 s. 41; E.R. 5 of 2020)

subsection.content: All places in which poisons are required by this regulation to be stored shall be inspected at regular intervals of time not exceeding three months by a registered pharmacist or registered medical practitioner appointed for the purpose by the governing body of the institution and a record of all inspections shall be made in a book kept at the institution.

section.name: s24A
section.heading: Applications to be entered on list under section 25

subsection.content: Any application under section 25(1) shall be made in writing to the Committee and shall be accompanied by the fee specified in Schedule 9. (E.R. 5 of 2020)

content.leadIn: The Committee may grant or refuse any application under this regulation and shall notify the applicant of its decision:
content.proviso: Provided that if the Committee intends to refuse an application the Committee shall first notify the applicant and the applicant may, not later than 14 days after the date of such notification, submit representations in writing to the Committee in support of his application.

subsection.content: Where the Committee grants an application under this regulation the Committee shall notify the Board of its decision and shall state whether the applicant has paid the prescribed fee.
Any applicant aggrieved by a decision made in respect of the applicant under this regulation may, in the prescribed manner, appeal to the Tribunal against that decision. (2 of 2015 s. 42)

part.name: P5B
part.heading: Registration of Premises of Authorized Sellers of Poisons

section.name: s24B
section.heading: Applications to register premises under section 13
section.leadIn: An application to register premises under section 13 shall be—

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: submitted together with a copy of the certificate of registration of the registered pharmacist by whom or in whose presence and under whose supervision the actual sale of poisons will be conducted under section 11(1) of the Ordinance. (2 of 2015 s. 43)

part.name: P6
part.heading: Wholesale Dealing in Poisons and Pharmaceutical Products

section.name: s25
section.heading: Sale and supply of poisons or pharmaceutical products wholesale
section.leadIn: A person must not, by way of wholesale dealing, sell or supply at or from any premises a pharmaceutical product, or a substance or article consisting of or containing any poison, unless the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: holds a wholesale dealer licence issued to the person by the Committee in respect of those premises;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is an authorized seller of poisons; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is a licensed manufacturer selling or supplying only pharmaceutical products manufactured by the licensed manufacturer.

section.name: s26
section.heading: Pharmacy and Poisons (Wholesale Licences) Committee

subsection.content: There shall be for the purposes of this Part a Committee to be called the Pharmacy and Poisons (Wholesale Licences) Committee.
The Committee may, subject to any conditions it thinks fit to impose, issue a wholesale dealer licence on payment of the fee prescribed in Schedule 9. (E.R. 5 of 2020)
The issue of a wholesale dealer licence shall be at the discretion of the Committee and shall be in the specified form.

subsection.leadIn: In any of the circumstances specified in paragraph (5A), the Committee may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: revoke a wholesale dealer licence or suspend it for a period it thinks fit;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: issue a warning letter to the licensed wholesale dealer; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: vary a condition of the licence imposed under paragraph (3). (2 of 2015 s. 46)

subsection.name: 5A
subsection.leadIn: The circumstances are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: that, in the Committee’s opinion, the licensed wholesale dealer has contravened—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a condition of the licence; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any of these regulations or a code of practice applicable to the licensed wholesale dealer; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: that the licensed wholesale dealer has been convicted of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an offence under the Ordinance or any of the regulations made under section 29, the Dangerous Drugs Ordinance (Cap. 134), the Antibiotics Ordinance (Cap. 137) or the Undesirable Medical Advertisements Ordinance (Cap. 231); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an offence under section 6C or 6D of the Import and Export Ordinance (Cap. 60), section 52, 54 or 61 of the Public Health and Municipal Services Ordinance (Cap. 132) or section 7, 7A or 9 of the Trade Descriptions Ordinance (Cap. 362). (2 of 2015 s. 46)

subsection.name: 5B
subsection.def: The Committee may, subject to any conditions it thinks fit to impose, suspend for a period not exceeding 3 years (suspension period) the operation of a decision made under paragraph (5)(a) so that the decision takes effect only if a condition so imposed is contravened during the suspension period, and in the case of such a contravention, the decision takes effect on the date specified by the Committee having regard to all the circumstances of the case. (2 of 2015 s. 46)

subsection.content: Any applicant or licensed wholesale dealer aggrieved by a decision of the Committee under this regulation may, in the prescribed manner, appeal to the Tribunal against that decision. (L.N. 369 of 1980)

subsection.leadIn: An applicant for a wholesale dealer licence— (2 of 2015 s. 46)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall nominate in writing a responsible person to be in charge of the poisons or pharmaceutical products; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may nominate in writing one or more deputies to act during the temporary absence of the responsible person.

subsection.content: An applicant shall at the time of his application submit to the Secretary the name of the person so nominated and of any deputy, and shall advise the Secretary of any change within 7 days of its occurrence.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.def: a person was issued with a wholesale poisons licence under this regulation, as in force before the commencement date* of the Pharmacy and Poisons (Amendment) Ordinance 2015 (2 of 2015) (amending Ordinance); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that licence was in force immediately before that date,

subsection.continued: then, for the remainder of the period for which that licence would have continued to be valid had section 46 of the amending Ordinance not been enacted, the person is to be regarded as a licensed wholesale dealer, and the Ordinance and regulations made under section 29 apply to the person accordingly. (2 of 2015 s. 46)

section.name: s27
section.heading: Sales of poisons by licensed wholesale dealers or licensed manufacturers
section.leadIn: A licensed wholesale dealer or licensed manufacturer must not sell or supply a poison to any person other than the following— (2 of 2015 s. 47)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a licensed wholesale dealer; (2 of 2015 s. 47)

paragraph.name: ab
paragraph.content: a licensed manufacturer; (2 of 2015 s. 47)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an authorized seller of poisons;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a registered pharmacist;

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.content: persons who require the poison for the purpose of their trade or business;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a Government department or public officer requiring the article for the purposes of the public service;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: a person or an establishment concerned with education or scientific research, if the article is required for the purposes of such education or research;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: an institution;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: purchasers outside Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: a listed seller of poisons, if the poison is included in the classes of poisons in Part 2 of the Poisons List that the listed seller is licensed to sell. (2 of 2015 s. 47)

section.name: s28
section.heading: Records to be kept by licensed wholesale dealers or licensed manufacturers

subsection.leadIn: A licensed wholesale dealer or licensed manufacturer must record the following particulars for each transaction by which any poison included in Part 1 of the Poisons List or any pharmaceutical product is acquired by him whether by way of import, purchase, gift or otherwise— (L.N. 137 of 1978; 2 of 2015 s. 48)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date of the transaction;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the name of the supplier;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the name of the poison or pharmaceutical product;

paragraph.name: ca
d
paragraph.content: the total quantity of the poison or pharmaceutical product;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the nature of the transaction; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a reference to the invoice or other documents supporting the transaction.

subsection.leadIn: A licensed wholesale dealer or licensed manufacturer must record the following particulars for each transaction by which any poison included in Part 1 of the Poisons List or any pharmaceutical product is disposed of, whether the disposition is by way of export, sale, gift or otherwise— (L.N. 137 of 1978; 2 of 2015 s. 48)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date of the transaction;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the nature of the transaction;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the name of the person to whom the poison or pharmaceutical product is supplied;

paragraph.name: ca
paragraph.content: for an advanced therapy product supplied for use by a registered medical practitioner or registered dentist—the name and address of the practitioner or dentist; (19 of 2020 s. 7)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the total quantity of the poison or pharmaceutical product;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a reference to the invoice or other documents supporting the transaction;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the name of the poison or pharmaceutical product;

paragraph.name: fa
g
paragraph.content: the balance of the poison or pharmaceutical product remaining in his possession after the transaction.

subsection.content: For each poison in Part 1 of the Poisons List or pharmaceutical product there shall be a separate entry in the records and all transactions involving that poison or pharmaceutical product shall be entered in a part of the records reserved for that poison or pharmaceutical product.
Unless the Committee approves another system of recording, all records of transactions must be in the specified form.
Every transaction to which these regulations relate shall be recorded within 72 hours after the time it took place.
Records of sales or supplies maintained under this regulation shall be supported by documents signed by the purchaser.
In the case of an import or export transaction, the licensed wholesale dealer or licensed manufacturer must retain all shipping and other documents supporting the transaction. (L.N. 137 of 1978)

A licensed wholesale dealer must set up and maintain a system of control that will enable the rapid and, so far as practicable, complete recall of any lot or batch of a pharmaceutical substance or product from sale to the public in the event of the pharmaceutical substance or product being found to be dangerous or injurious to health. (L.N. 137 of 1978)

section.name: s28A
section.heading: Good Manufacturing Practice Guide

subsection.content: The Board may issue a Good Manufacturing Practice Guide providing for the principles and guidelines of good manufacturing practice in respect of pharmaceutical products.

subsection.leadIn: The GMP Guide—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may consist of a code, standard, rule, specification or any other documentary form of practical guidance prepared by the Board or any other body or authority; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may apply, incorporate or refer to a document that has been formulated or published by a body or authority either as in force at the time when the document is so applied, incorporated or referred to or as amended, formulated or published from time to time.

subsection.leadIn: If the GMP Guide is issued, the Board must by notice published in the Gazette—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: identify the Guide; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify the date on which the Guide is to take effect.

subsection.content: The Board may from time to time revise the whole or any part of the GMP Guide.

subsection.leadIn: If the GMP Guide is revised, the Board must by notice published in the Gazette—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: identify the Guide or part revised; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify the date on which the revision is to take effect.

subsection.leadIn: The Board must make a copy of the GMP Guide available for inspection by the public free of charge—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at the office of the Secretary during normal office hours; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other manner the Board thinks fit.

subsection.content: The GMP Guide, and a notice published under paragraph (3) or (5), are not subsidiary legislation.

section.name: s29
section.heading: Licensing of manufacturers

subsection.content: A person must not manufacture any pharmaceutical product on any premises unless he is the holder of a licence to manufacture pharmaceutical products on those premises.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of paragraph (1), a person is not regarded as manufacturing a pharmaceutical product only by affixing to the container of the product a label—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: that does not state any of the following particulars—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: particulars mentioned in regulation 31(1)(a), (b), (e), (f) or (g); (19 of 2020 s. 8)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: particulars regarding the dosage, route or frequency of administration of the product;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the name of the product; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: that does not obscure, change or obliterate any of the following particulars labelled on the container—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: particulars mentioned in subparagraph (a);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: particulars mentioned in regulation 31(1)(c). (2 of 2015 s. 50)

subsection.content: The Committee may, subject to any conditions it thinks fit to impose, issue a licence to manufacture pharmaceutical products in the specified form on payment of the fee prescribed in Schedule 9. (E.R. 5 of 2020)

subsection.leadIn: In any of the circumstances specified in paragraph (4A), the Committee may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: revoke a licence to manufacture pharmaceutical products or suspend it for a period it thinks fit;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: issue a warning letter to the licensed manufacturer; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: vary a condition of the licence imposed under paragraph (3). (2 of 2015 s. 50)

subsection.name: 4A
subsection.leadIn: The circumstances are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: that, in the Committee’s opinion, the licensed manufacturer has contravened—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a condition of the licence or any of these regulations; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a code of practice applicable to the licensed manufacturer or the GMP Guide; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: that the licensed manufacturer has been convicted of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an offence under the Ordinance or any of the regulations made under section 29, the Dangerous Drugs Ordinance (Cap. 134), the Antibiotics Ordinance (Cap. 137) or the Undesirable Medical Advertisements Ordinance (Cap. 231); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an offence under section 6C or 6D of the Import and Export Ordinance (Cap. 60), section 52, 54 or 61 of the Public Health and Municipal Services Ordinance (Cap. 132) or section 7, 7A or 9 of the Trade Descriptions Ordinance (Cap. 362). (2 of 2015 s. 50)

subsection.name: 4B
subsection.def: The Committee may, subject to any conditions it thinks fit to impose, suspend for a period not exceeding 3 years (suspension period) the operation of a decision made under paragraph (4)(a) so that the decision takes effect only if a condition so imposed is contravened during the suspension period, and in the case of such a contravention, the decision takes effect on the date specified by the Committee having regard to all the circumstances of the case. (2 of 2015 s. 50)

subsection.leadIn: For the purpose of certifying that a manufacturer is licensed under this regulation, the Committee, subject to any conditions it may impose and to the payment of the fee prescribed in Schedule 9, may issue to the manufacturer— (E.R. 5 of 2020)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a certificate for manufacture; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an interim-certificate for manufacture,

subsection.leadIn: For the purpose of exporting pharmaceutical products manufactured by a licensed manufacturer, the Committee may, subject to any conditions it may impose and to the payment of the fee prescribed in Schedule 9, issue to the manufacturer— (2 of 2015 s. 50; E.R. 5 of 2020)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a free sale certificate of pharmaceutical product; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a certificate of pharmaceutical product,

subsection.content: Any applicant or licensed manufacturer aggrieved by a decision of the Committee under this regulation may, in the prescribed manner, appeal to the Tribunal against that decision. (L.N. 369 of 1980)

section.name: s30
section.heading: Manufacture to be under supervision of a registered pharmacist

subsection.leadIn: In all premises in which pharmaceutical products are manufactured such products shall be manufactured by or under the supervision of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a registered pharmacist; or (2 of 2015 s. 51)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a person having such other qualifications or sufficient experience as may be approved by the Board.

subsection.def: For the purposes of paragraph (1), supervision (監督) means the exercise by any of the persons referred to in paragraph (1) of control over the process of manufacture and of the persons engaged therein. (L.N. 137 of 1978)

section.name: s30A
section.heading: Authorized person to certify compliance with GMP Guide etc.

subsection.content: A licensed manufacturer must ensure that at least one authorized person is employed to be responsible for carrying out, in relation to the pharmaceutical products manufactured under the licence, the duties specified in paragraph (2).

subsection.leadIn: An authorized person is responsible for ensuring and certifying that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: each batch of the pharmaceutical products has been manufactured and checked in accordance with the GMP Guide; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the registrable particulars of each batch of the pharmaceutical products correspond exactly with the registered particulars of the products.

subsection.leadIn: In this regulation—
subsection.def: registered particulars (註冊詳情) has the meaning given by regulation 35A;
registrable particulars (須註冊詳情) has the meaning given by regulation 35A.

section.name: s30B
section.heading: Register of authorized persons

subsection.content: The Board must cause the Secretary to keep a register of authorized persons for the purposes of these regulations.
The register may be kept in a form the Board thinks fit.

subsection.leadIn: The register must contain, for each person who is registered as an authorized person under this Part—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name and address of the person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other particulars of the person the Board thinks fit.

subsection.content: The Board may amend the register as to the name, address or any other particulars relating to an authorized person whose name appears in the register on being satisfied that the amendment is necessary for preserving the accuracy of the register.

subsection.leadIn: The Secretary must make the register available for inspection by the public free of charge at the office of the Secretary during normal office hours, and in any other manner the Secretary thinks fit, so as to enable a member of the public—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to ascertain whether a person is an authorized person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to ascertain the particulars of the registration of the person.

section.name: s30C
section.heading: Application for registration as authorized person

subsection.content: A person who satisfies the requirements specified in paragraph (2) may apply to the Committee for registration as an authorized person.

subsection.leadIn: The requirements are that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is a registered pharmacist; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: holds a qualification awarded on completion of a course recognized by the Committee; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: has at least 3 years’ relevant experience in Hong Kong or a place outside Hong Kong in manufacturing pharmaceutical products in accordance with the GMP Guide or a document similar or equivalent to that Guide issued or adopted by a competent authority of a place outside Hong Kong; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: meets any other criteria that the Committee may specify.

subsection.content: The application must be in the specified form.
The Committee may require the applicant to provide any information or document that the Committee considers reasonably necessary for determining the application.

section.name: s30D
section.heading: Registration as authorized person

subsection.content: The Committee must decide whether to grant or refuse an application for registration made under regulation 30C.
The Committee may grant an application on being satisfied that the applicant is a fit and proper person to be registered as an authorized person.
A registration under this regulation is subject to any conditions the Committee thinks fit to impose.
On registration, the Committee must issue to the applicant a certificate of registration in the specified form on payment of the fee prescribed in Schedule 9. (E.R. 5 of 2020)
Subject to regulation 30F, a registration has effect from the date on which the certificate of registration is issued until the end of the year in which the date falls.
An applicant aggrieved by a decision made in respect of the applicant under this regulation may, in the prescribed manner, appeal to the Tribunal against that decision.

section.name: s30E
section.heading: Renewal of registration of authorized person

subsection.content: The Committee may, on an application, renew the registration of an authorized person.
An application for renewal of registration must be in the specified form.
The Committee may require the applicant to provide any information or document that the Committee considers reasonably necessary for determining the application.
A registration renewed under this regulation is subject to any conditions the Committee thinks fit to impose.
On renewal of registration, the Committee must issue to the applicant a renewed certificate of registration in the specified form on payment of the fee prescribed in Schedule 9. (E.R. 5 of 2020)
Subject to regulation 30F, a renewed registration has effect from the date on which the renewed certificate of registration is issued until the end of the year in which the date falls.
An applicant aggrieved by a decision made in respect of the applicant under this regulation may, in the prescribed manner, appeal to the Tribunal against that decision.

section.name: s30F
section.heading: Cancellation or suspension etc. of registration as authorized person

subsection.leadIn: The Committee may exercise any one or more of the following powers in any of the circumstances specified in paragraph (2) in respect of a person registered as an authorized person under this Part—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: cancel the registration;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: suspend the registration for a period specified by the Committee;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: issue a warning letter to the person;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: vary a condition of the registration imposed under regulation 30D(3) or 30E(4).

subsection.leadIn: The circumstances are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the Committee is satisfied that the person is no longer a fit and proper person to be registered as an authorized person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: that in the Committee’s opinion, the person has contravened—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a condition of the registration; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any of these regulations or a code of practice applicable to the person as an authorized person; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: that the person has been convicted of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an offence under the Ordinance or any of the regulations made under section 29, the Dangerous Drugs Ordinance (Cap. 134), the Antibiotics Ordinance (Cap. 137) or the Undesirable Medical Advertisements Ordinance (Cap. 231); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an offence under section 52, 54 or 61 of the Public Health and Municipal Services Ordinance (Cap. 132) or section 7, 7A or 9 of the Trade Descriptions Ordinance (Cap. 362).

subsection.def: The Committee may, subject to any conditions it thinks fit to impose, suspend for a period not exceeding 3 years (suspension period) the operation of a decision made under paragraph (1)(a) or (b) so that the decision takes effect only if a condition so imposed is contravened during the suspension period, and in the case of such a contravention, the decision takes effect on the date specified by the Committee having regard to all the circumstances of the case.

subsection.leadIn: The Committee must cause the Secretary to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: as soon as practicable after cancelling a person’s registration under paragraph (1)(a), remove the entries relating to the person from the register of authorized persons; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: as soon as practicable after suspending a person’s registration under paragraph (1)(b), remove the entries relating to the person from the register of authorized persons, and restore those entries to the register as soon as practicable after the period of suspension expires.

subsection.content: A person whose registration as an authorized person is cancelled must immediately return to the Committee the certificate of registration or renewed certificate of registration issued to the person under regulation 30D or 30E.
A person mentioned in paragraph (1) who is aggrieved by a decision made in respect of the person under this regulation may, in the prescribed manner, appeal to the Tribunal against that decision.

section.name: s31
section.heading: Labelling by licensed manufacturers

subsection.leadIn: Subject to paragraph (4), a licensed manufacturer shall label or cause to be labelled the container of each pharmaceutical product, with the following particulars— (2 of 2015 s. 53)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the appropriate designation of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the substance or substances from which the pharmaceutical product was manufactured;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: each of the active constituents of the product; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: each of the ingredients from which the product was compounded;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: the name and address of the manufacturer; (2 of 2015 s. 53)

paragraph.name: d
e
f
g
paragraph.leadIn: for an advanced therapy product—

subparagraph.content: the product code, and the unique donation identifier, assigned in accordance with the codes of practice issued by the Board; and

subparagraph.leadIn: if the product is for autologous use only—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the unique recipient identifier assigned in accordance with the codes of practice issued by the Board; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the English words “For autologous use only” or the Chinese characters “只供自體使用”. (19 of 2020 s. 9)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of paragraph (1)—

def.name: AppropriateDesignation
def.leadIn: the expression appropriate designation (適當稱號), in relation to a substance, constituent or ingredient, means—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: in the case where a substance, constituent or ingredient is not a poison and is described in any of the monographs contained in the edition of the British Pharmacopoeia, the British Pharmaceutical Codex or the British Veterinary Codex which was last published before the date on which the article was sold or supplied, the description set out at the head of that monograph; and

subparagraph.name: iii

def.name: AppropriateQuantitativeParticulars
def.leadIn: the expression appropriate quantitative particulars (適當數量詳情), in relation to the active constituent or ingredient of a pharmaceutical product, means—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the percentage or quantity of that constituent or ingredient contained in the pharmaceutical product sold or supplied; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of a pharmaceutical product which is in pill, capsule, tablet or similar article, either the percentage or quantity of the substance or substances comprising or forming part of the pills, capsules, tablets or similar articles, or the quantity of each constituent or ingredient in each pill, capsule, tablet or article; (2 of 2015 s. 53)

def.name: BatchNumber
def.leadIn: batch number (批次編號), in relation to a pharmaceutical product, means a unique combination of numbers, letters or other symbols from which—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the batch or lot to which the product belongs can be identified; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the production and distribution history of the product can be determined. (2 of 2015 s. 53; 19 of 2020 s. 9)

subsection.content: For the purposes of paragraph (1) the container to be labelled shall, where the pharmaceutical product is packed by the manufacturer in more than one container, be the container which is likely to be sold or distributed to the ultimate user of the product.

subsection.leadIn: In the case of a pharmaceutical product intended for export it shall be a sufficient compliance with this regulation if the container of the product is labelled with the following particulars—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name and address of the manufacturer; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: such other details as the importing country may require. (L.N. 137 of 1978)

section.name: s32
section.heading: Manufacturing workers not to infect products
section.content: A licensed manufacturer must take adequate steps to ensure that every person engaged in the manufacturing of pharmaceutical products does not contaminate or infect such products.

section.name: s33
section.heading: Duties of licensed manufacturers regarding identity, purity, safety, etc.

subsection.content: Subject to paragraph (1A), a licensed manufacturer must test each lot or batch of raw or bulk material intended to be used in the manufacture of pharmaceutical products to ensure identity and purity. (L.N. 137 of 1978)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: Raw or bulk material the identity and purity of which the manufacturer thereof has certified by a certificate of analysis does not require a test by a licensed manufacturer under paragraph (1). (L.N. 137 of 1978)

A licensed manufacturer must ensure that the registrable particulars of each batch of pharmaceutical products in a finished form correspond exactly with the registered particulars of the products. (2 of 2015 s. 55)

Every parenteral product shall be manufactured in accordance with the method of preparation of injections laid down by the British Pharmacopoeia or other Pharmacopoeia with which the particular product is intended to comply.

Unless paragraph (4B) or (4D) applies, a licensed manufacturer must retain a control sample of each batch of finished products under conditions of storage suitable to that product for a period of not less than 1 year after the expiry date of the product. (L.N. 137 of 1978; 19 of 2020 s. 10)

subsection.name: 4A
subsection.leadIn: Paragraph (4B) applies to a licensed manufacturer in respect of a batch of pharmaceutical products if all of the following conditions are satisfied—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the products are enclosed in a primary container in which the products are to be sold or supplied;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the process of manufacture that the manufacturer carries out, in respect of the products, only involves one or more of the following—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: adding a package insert;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: replacing a package insert;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.leadIn: (if the products are intended for export) affixing a label to any labelled container of the products, and the label does not obscure, change or obliterate any of the following particulars appearing on that labelled container—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: particulars required to be labelled under regulation 31(4);

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the name of the products;

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: the batch number of the products;

subparagraph.name: D
subparagraph.content: the expiry date of the products;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.leadIn: (if the products are not intended for export) affixing a label to any labelled container of the products, and the label does not obscure, change or obliterate any of the following particulars appearing on that labelled container—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the registered particulars of the products;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the batch number of the products;

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: the expiry date of the products;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: throughout the process of manufacture, the primary container remains closed. (2 of 2015 s. 55)

subsection.name: 4B
subsection.leadIn: The manufacturer is only required to retain a sample of the following of the batch of finished products for a period of not less than 1 year after the expiry date of the products—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if paragraph (4A)(b)(i) applies, the package insert added;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if paragraph (4A)(b)(ii) applies, the replacing package insert;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if paragraph (4A)(b)(iii) or (iv) applies, the label affixed. (2 of 2015 s. 55)

subsection.name: 4C
subsection.content: Paragraph (4D) applies to a licensed manufacturer of an advanced therapy product containing or consisting of cells or tissues. (19 of 2020 s. 10)

subsection.name: 4D
subsection.content: The manufacturer is only required to keep photographs that clearly present the particulars mentioned in regulation 31(1) of each batch of finished products for a period of not less than 1 year after the expiry date of the products. (19 of 2020 s. 10)

A licensed manufacturer must set up and maintain a system of control that will enable the rapid and, so far as practicable, complete recall of any lot or batch of a pharmaceutical substance or product from sale to the public in the event of the pharmaceutical substance or product being found to be dangerous or injurious to health. (L.N. 137 of 1978)

Despite paragraphs (4), (4B)(c) and (4D), a licensed manufacturer is not required to comply with paragraph (4), (4B)(c) or (4D) (as applicable) in respect of a batch of pharmaceutical products if the manufacturer is not regarded as manufacturing the products for the purposes of regulation 29(1). (2 of 2015 s. 55; 19 of 2020 s. 10)

subsection.leadIn: In this regulation—
subsection.def: batch number (批次編號) has the meaning given by regulation 31(2)(c);

def.name: LabelledContainer
def.leadIn: labelled container (帶標籤容器), for a pharmaceutical product, means a container of the product on which the following particulars appear—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the product;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the batch number of the product;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the expiry date of the product;

subsection.def: package insert (包裝附頁) has the meaning given by regulation 36(3A);
primary container (最內層容器), for a pharmaceutical product, means the container that is in direct contact with the product;
registered particulars (註冊詳情) has the meaning given by regulation 35A;
registrable particulars (須註冊詳情) has the meaning given by regulation 35A. (2 of 2015 s. 55)

section.name: s34
section.heading: Licensed manufacturer’s premises

subsection.leadIn: No pharmaceutical product shall be manufactured unless the premises and the fittings and machinery therein used in the manufacturing of such product are of such construction, materials and finish as to— (2 of 2015 s. 56)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: permit the ready and efficient cleaning of all surfaces; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: avoid the contamination of the product during manufacture. (2 of 2015 s. 56)

subsection.leadIn: All premises used in the manufacturing, testing and despatch of pharmaceutical products shall be— (2 of 2015 s. 56)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: suitable for the purpose; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: maintained in a clean and orderly condition.

subsection.content: The temperature and humidity of the premises shall be controlled as appropriate to the manufacture of the product or the process being carried out therein.
All parenteral products shall be manufactured and put into containers in an enclosed area in which aseptic conditions can be maintained.
The enclosed area referred to in paragraph (4) shall be separate from the areas used for the manufacture of other pharmaceutical products. (2 of 2015 s. 56)

section.name: s35
section.heading: Records to be kept by licensed manufacturers

subsection.leadIn: A licensed manufacturer must maintain adequate records in respect of each pharmaceutical product prepared by him, showing— (2 of 2015 s. 57)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the quantities of all substances used in the manufacture of the product;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the quantity of the product manufactured;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the name and the address of the person to whom the pharmaceutical product was sold or supplied;

paragraph.name: ca
paragraph.content: for an advanced therapy product sold or supplied for use by a registered medical practitioner or registered dentist—the name and address of the practitioner or dentist; (19 of 2020 s. 11)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the nature and results of tests made on each lot or batch of raw or bulk materials used in the product;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the nature and results of tests made on each batch of finished product;

paragraph.name: f
g
paragraph.content: the nature and result of any tests made on the samples retained; and (L.N. 228 of 1975)

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.leadIn: for an advanced therapy product containing or consisting of cells or tissues—

subparagraph.content: the name and address of the person from whom the cells or tissues used for the preparation of the product were obtained; and
the unique donation identifier assigned in accordance with the codes of practice issued by the Board. (19 of 2020 s. 11)

subsection.content: A record showing the matters mentioned in paragraph (1)(a), (b), (d), (e), (g) or (h) must be completed when the manufacturing process or test concerned is being carried out. (2 of 2015 s. 57)
A record showing the matters mentioned in paragraph (1)(c) or (ca) must be completed within 72 hours after the transaction concerned takes place. (2 of 2015 s. 57)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of paragraph (1)(f)—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: a record showing an action taken in respect of a complaint must be completed within 72 hours after the action is taken. (2 of 2015 s. 57)

part.name: P8
part.heading: Registration of Pharmaceutical Products and Substances

section.name: s35A
section.heading: Interpretation (Part 8)
section.leadIn: In this Part, unless the context otherwise requires—
section.def: additional particulars (附加詳情), in relation to a pharmaceutical product or substance registered before the commencement date, means those registrable particulars of the product or substance not referred to in the repealed regulation 36(3);
commencement date (生效日期) means the commencement date* of section 4 of the Pharmacy and Poisons (Amendment) (No. 2) Regulation 1995 (L.N. 366 of 1995);

def.name: RegisteredParticulars

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a pharmaceutical product or substance registered before the commencement date—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: such of its particulars as are registered under the repealed regulation 36(3); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: its additional particulars as contained in or ascertainable from the application form, the relevant literature and supporting documents (if any) submitted to the Committee for the purpose of the registration of the product or substance, or as contained in or ascertainable from the specimen sales packs or samples (or prototypes of the packs and proposed wordings of the labels) made available for inspection by the Committee for the purpose of the registration of the product or substance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a pharmaceutical product or substance registered on or after the commencement date, its registrable particulars as registered under regulation 36(3), or

def.continued: in either case, where from time to time any subsequent approval has been given by the Board or the Committee to change any of the registrable particulars of the product or substance as from a certain date, then as from that date, its said particulars changed in accordance with such approval;

section.def: registered product or substance (註冊製品或物質) means any pharmaceutical product or substance which is the subject of a valid registration certificate issued under regulation 36(5);

registrable particulars (須註冊詳情), in relation to a pharmaceutical substance, means the particulars referred to in regulation 36(3)(a), and, in relation to a pharmaceutical product, means all of the particulars referred to in regulation 36(3)(a) and (b);
repealed regulation 36(3) (已廢除的第36(3)條) means the regulation 36(3) which was in force immediately before the commencement date.

section.name: s36
section.heading: Registration of pharmaceutical products and substances

subsection.leadIn: Subject to paragraphs (1A), (1B) and (1C), no person shall sell, offer for sale or distribute or possess for the purposes of sale, distribution or other use any pharmaceutical product or substance unless the product or substance is registered with the Board— (L.N. 85 of 1987; L.N. 366 of 1995)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by the licensed manufacturer, or a licensed wholesale dealer who has entered into a contract with the licensed manufacturer under which the licensed manufacturer is required to manufacture the pharmaceutical product or substance, if the pharmaceutical product or substance is manufactured in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by a person referred to in section 28A(1) or (3) who imports the pharmaceutical product or substance into Hong Kong, if the pharmaceutical product or substance is manufactured outside Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by the local branch, subsidiary, representative, agent or distributor of a manufacturer outside Hong Kong. (L.N. 137 of 1978; 23 of 1998 s. 2; 2 of 2015 s. 58)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: Nothing in paragraph (1) shall apply in the case of possession or use where the pharmaceutical product or substance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: has been imported into Hong Kong—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to be exported outside Hong Kong; or (2 of 2015 s. 58)

subparagraph.name: ii

paragraph.name: ab
paragraph.content: is possessed or is to be used for the purpose of treatment by a registered medical practitioner or a registered dentist of a particular patient or for the purpose of treatment by a registered veterinary surgeon of a particular animal; (2 of 2015 s. 58)

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: is to be administered for the purposes of a clinical trial that is to be conducted in accordance with a clinical trial certificate issued under regulation 36B(3); or (2 of 2015 s. 58)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: is to be administered for the purposes of a medicinal test that is to be conducted in accordance with a medicinal test certificate issued under regulation 36B(3). (2 of 2015 s. 58)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.content: For the avoidance of any doubt, a pharmaceutical product or substance is registered with the Board, for the purposes of paragraph (1), if and only if its registrable particulars are those which correspond exactly with the registered particulars of a registered product or substance. (L.N. 366 of 1995)

subsection.name: 1C
subsection.content: It shall be a defence to a charge against any person for contravening paragraph (1) if the person proves that he did not know and could not with reasonable diligence have discovered that the product or substance was not registered with the Board. (L.N. 366 of 1995)

Application for the initial registration of a pharmaceutical product or substance shall be made in the specified form and shall be accompanied by the fee prescribed in Schedule 9. (2 of 2015 s. 58; E.R. 5 of 2020)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: In considering an application for registration of a pharmaceutical product which contains as active ingredients any Chinese herbal medicines or proprietary Chinese medicines as defined in section 2 of the Chinese Medicine Ordinance (Cap. 549) or other materials of herbal, animal or mineral origin customarily used by the Chinese for medicinal purpose, the Board shall seek advice from the Chinese Medicines Board established under the Chinese Medicine Ordinance (Cap. 549). (47 of 1999 s. 175)

subsection.leadIn: The particulars to be registered shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a product or substance, be—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: its name;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: its specifications;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: its label;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: its package insert, if any;

subparagraph.name: v
